forest.sycamore package¶

forest.sycamore.base module¶

forest.sycamore.base.survey_stats_main(study_folder: str, output_folder: str, tz_str: str = 'UTC', participant_ids: Optional[List] = None, time_start: Optional[str] = None, time_end: Optional[str] = None, config_path: Optional[str] = None, interventions_filepath: Optional[str] = None) → bool¶

Compute statistics on surveys

Args: output_folder(str):

File path to output summaries and details

study_folder(str):

File path to study data

config_path(str):

File path to study configuration file

time_start(str):

The first date of the survey data

time_end(str):

The last date of the survey data

participant_ids(list):

List of users in study for which we are generating a survey schedule

tz_str(str):

Timezone of study. This defaults to “UTC”

interventions_filepath(str):

filepath where interventions json file is.

forest.sycamore.common module¶

forest.sycamore.common.aggregate_surveys(study_dir: str, users: Optional[list] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Aggregate Survey Data

Reads all survey data from a downloaded study folder and stacks data together. Standardizes question types between iOS and Android devices.

Parameters

  • study_dir (str) – path to downloaded data. This is a folder that includes the user data in a subfolder with the beiwe_id as the subfolder name

  • users (list) – List of users to aggregate survey data over

Returns

An aggregated dataframe that has a question index field to understand if there are multiple lines for one question.

Return type

all_data(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.common.aggregate_surveys_config(study_dir: str, config_path: str, study_tz: str = 'UTC', users: Optional[list] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Aggregate surveys when config is available

Merges stacked survey data with processed configuration file data and removes lines that are not questions or submission lines

Parameters

  • study_dir (str) – path to downloaded data. This is a folder that includes the user data in a subfolder with the beiwe_id as the subfolder name

  • config_path (str) – path to the study configuration file

  • study_tz (str) – Timezone of study. This defaults to “UTC”

  • users (tuple) – List of beiwe IDs of users to aggregate

Returns

Merged data frame

Return type

df_merged(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.common.aggregate_surveys_no_config(study_dir: str, study_tz: str = 'UTC', users: Optional[list] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Clean aggregated data

Parameters

  • study_dir (str) – path to downloaded data. This is a folder that includes the user data in a subfolder with the beiwe_id as the subfolder name

  • study_tz (str) – Timezone of study. This defaults to “UTC”

  • users (tuple) – List of Beiwe IDs to run

forest.sycamore.common.convert_timezone_df(df_merged: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, tz_str: str = 'UTC', utc_col: str = 'UTC time') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Convert a df to local time zone

Parameters

  • df_merged (DataFrame) – Dataframe that has a field of dates that are in UTC time

  • tz_str (str) – Study timezone (this should be a string from the pytz library)

  • utc_col – Name of column in data that has UTC time dates

Return type

df_merged(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.common.parse_surveys(config_path: str, answers_l: bool = False) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Get survey information from config path

Parameters

  • config_path (str) – path to the study configuration file

  • answers_l (bool) – If True, include question answers in summary

Returns

A dataframe with all surveys, question ids, question texts, question types

forest.sycamore.common.q_types_standardize(q: str, lkp: Optional[dict] = None) → str¶

Standardizes question types using a lookup function

Parameters

  • q (str) – a single value for a question type

  • lkp (dict) – a lookup dictionary of question types and what they should map too. Based on Josh’s dictionary of question types.

Returns

string with the corrected question type

Return type

s

forest.sycamore.common.read_and_aggregate(study_dir: str, beiwe_id: str, data_stream: str) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Read and aggregate data for a user

Reads in all downloaded data for a particular user and data stream and stacks the datasets

Parameters

  • study_dir (str) – path to downloaded data. This is a folder that includes the user data in a subfolder with the beiwe_id as the subfolder name

  • beiwe_id (str) – ID of user to aggregate data

  • data_stream (str) – Data stream to aggregate. Must be a datastream name as downloaded from the server (TODO: ADD A CHECK)

Returns

dataframe with stacked data, a field for the beiwe ID, a field for the day of week.

Return type

survey_data (DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.responses module¶

forest.sycamore.responses.agg_changed_answers(agg: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Add first/last times and changed answers to agg DataFrame

Function that takes aggregated data and adds list of changed answers and first and last times and answers.

Parameters

agg (DataFrame) – Aggregated Data

Returns

Dataframe with aggregated data, one line per question answered, with changed answers aggregated into a list. The Final answer is in the “last_answer” field

Return type

agg(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.responses.agg_changed_answers_summary(config_path: str, agg: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → Tuple[Any, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]¶

Create Summary File with survey, beiwe id, question id, average number of changed answers, average time spent answering question

Parameters

  • config_path (str) – File path to study configuration file

  • agg (DataFrame) – Dataframe with aggregated data (output from aggregate_surveys_config)

Returns

Dataframe with aggregated data, one line per question answered,

with changed answers aggregated into a list. The Final answer is in the “last_answer” field

out(DataFrame):

Summary of how an individual answered each question, with their most common answer, time to answer, etc

Return type

detail(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.responses.subset_answer_choices(answer: list) → list¶

Remove Duplicate Answers

If a user changes their answers multiple times, an iOS device will have redundant answers at the beginning and end of the list, so we remove them. :param answer: List of changed answers :type answer: list

Returns

List of changed answers with redundant answers removed

Return type

answer(list)

forest.sycamore.submits module¶

forest.sycamore.submits.convert_time_to_date(submit_time: datetime.datetime, day: int, time: list) → list¶

Convert an array of times to date

Takes a single array of timings and a single day :param submit_time: date in week for which we want to extract another date and time :type submit_time: datetime :param day: desired day of week :type day: int :param time: List of timings times from the configuration surveys information :type time: list

forest.sycamore.submits.gen_survey_schedule(config_path: str, time_start: str, time_end: str, beiwe_ids: list, all_interventions_dict: dict) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Get survey schedule for a number of users

Parameters

  • config_path (str) – File path to study configuration file

  • time_start (str) – The first date of the survey data

  • time_end (str) – The last date of the survey data

  • beiwe_ids (list) – List of users in study for which we are generating a survey schedule

  • all_interventions_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing a key for every beiwe id. Each value in the dict is a dict, with a key for each intervention and a timestamp for each intervention time

Returns

DataFrame with a line for every survey deployed to every user in the study for the given time range

Return type

times_sur(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.submits.generate_survey_times(time_start: str, time_end: str, timings: Optional[list] = None, survey_type: str = 'weekly', intervention_dict: Optional[dict] = None) → list¶

Get delivery times for a survey

Takes a start time and end time and generates a schedule of all sent surveys in time frame for the given survey type :param time_start: The first date for which we want to generate survey times :type time_start: str :param time_end: The last date for which we want to generate survey times :type time_end: str :param timings: list of survey timings, directly from the configuration file

survey information

Parameters

  • survey_type (str) – What type of survey schedule to generate times for

  • intervention_dict (dict) – A dictionary with keys for each intervention time, each containing a timestamp object (only needed for relative surveys)

Returns

A list of all survey times that occur between the time_start and time_end per the given survey timings schedule

Return type

surveys(list)

forest.sycamore.submits.get_all_interventions_dict(filepath: Optional[str]) → dict¶

Read json file into interventions dict

Extracts user intervention information for use in survey_timings. :param filepath: the path to a json file containing patient interventions

information (downloaded from the beiwe website)

Returns

a dict with one key for each beiwe_id in the study. The value for each key is a dict with a key for each intervention in the study, and a value which is the timestamp

filepath(str)

forest.sycamore.submits.survey_submits(config_path: str, time_start: str, time_end: str, beiwe_ids: list, agg: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, all_interventions_dict: Optional[dict] = None) → Tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]¶

Get survey submits for users

Parameters

  • config_path (str) – File path to study configuration file

  • time_start (str) – The first date of the survey data

  • time_end (str) – The last date of the survey data

  • beiwe_ids (list) – List of users in study for which we are generating a survey schedule

  • all_interventions_dict (dict) – dict containing interventions for each user. Each key in the dict is a beiwe id. Each value is a dict, with a key for each intervention name and a timestamp for each intervention’s time

  • agg (DataFrame) –

  • aggregate_surveys_config (Dataframe of aggregated data. Output from) –

Returns

A DataFrame with all surveys deployed in the given timeframe on the study to the users with completion times submit_lines_summary(DataFrame): a DataFrame with all users, total surveys received, and responses.

Return type

submit_lines(DataFrame)

forest.sycamore.submits.survey_submits_no_config(study_dir: str, study_tz: str = 'UTC') → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Get survey submits without config file

Alternative function for getting the survey completions (doesn’t have expected times of surveys) :param study_dir: Directory where information is located :type study_dir: str :param study_tz: Time zone for local time :type study_tz: str
